answers.answer: There are several possibilities. one is that your optom lacks skill and cannot get it right.  OR you may have an eye disease such as cataracts that keeps you from seeing as well as you used to  OR your glasses RX could be changing as it sometimes does with undiagnosed or uncontrolled diabetes or with corneal disease. See an Eye MD ophthalmologist for further care.

question: I have seen my optometrist 5 times in the last 3 months. She has tried multiple RX's and NONE of them work.Every pair of glasses is still blurry. Every three weeks when I go back, my vision has changed. She says my refraction changes? I have to wear bi-focal also. My eyes are tired, dry, strained, blurry, and I cannot see at night to drive now. My eyes feel so tired and hurt because I have to strain to see.  Who could help me, what kind of specialist? She said it was hard to find the "center" when measuring my eyes for glasses. I do have an astigmatism as well. I have to wear 250 cheaters for up close and I just suffer the blur and strain for far vision.Why does my RX change so often? What can be done? Who can I see?
title: Cannot get RX right
